title: Image Inversion: A Survey from GANs to Diffusion and Beyond
author: Yinan Chen (Zhejiang University), Jiangning Zhang (Zhejiang University), Yali Bi (Southwest University), Xiaobin Hu (Tencent), Teng Hu (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Zhucun Xue (Zhejiang University), Ran Yi (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Yong Liu (Zhejiang University), Ying Tai (Nanjing University)
relevance_why: The survey covers advancements in generative models that can inform audio generation methods, particularly in modifying the latent representations and techniques that could potentially be adapted to audio tasks.
background: Image inversion is the process of mapping images back to their latent representations using pre-trained generative models, which is crucial for applications like editing and restoration.
contribution: This survey introduces a comprehensive overview of the state of image inversion techniques, categorizing them into GAN inversion and diffusion model inversion to enhance practical applications.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing surveys primarily focus on either GAN-based or diffusion-based approaches without a unified perspective.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates both paradigms and discusses their comparative effectiveness and applicability in a systematic manner.

key_innovation: Offers a systematic classification and detailed review of both GAN and diffusion model inversion techniques leading to insights for future research and real-world applications.
real_world_impact: This survey can guide future developments in image editing and restoration techniques, which can also influence related domains such as audio and music generation.
limitations: No explicit limitations mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs): **Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)** are a class of machine learning frameworks that consist of two neural networks, a generator and a discriminator, that compete against each other to produce realistic data.
new_terms.Diffusion Models: **Diffusion Models** are a type of generative model that generates data by simulating a diffusion process, iteratively refining random noise into coherent samples.

open_sourcing: The authors maintain a project page for tracking the latest developments at https://github.com/RyanChenYN/ImageInversion
